Description: Book of the Dead of Tui; frame 2; coloured vignettes; retrograde hieratic page numbers.
Curator's comments: The fragments are not in order; other parts of this papyrus are in Bologna, Museo Civico, KS 3168, from the Palagi collection (ex-Nizzoli?). Joins directly to P. Moscow I, 1b, 122 (Irmtraut Munro). Part of same papyrus, EA 79431.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (133546) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/133546)
Taylor et al 2011 / The history and conservation of the papyrus of Tuy (p.95-104, p.97, fig.2)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2010 4th Nov-2011 6th March, Round Reading Room BM, Book of the Dead 2012 July - September, Tokyo, Mori museum, The Book of the Dead: Journey Through the Afterlife 2012, October - November, Fukuoka Museum of Art, The Book of the Dead 2013, May - September, Perth, Western Australian Museum, The Book of the Dead
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, powdery, bleached Black ink Red ink Backed: Japanese paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: Filmoplast T self adhesive linen tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority:A Overall Condition:A Curatorial condition comment: fragmentary, very white papyrus
Associated names: Associated with: Tui (named in Bologna fragments only)
Acquisition notes: Lot Number 118 in the 1835 Salt Sale.
